content.html:
In this lesson, you will learn to characterize changes in functions quantitatively, by using average rates of change. You will also learn that the average rate of change can be used to measure how fast a function changes over a given interval.

When you finish this lesson, you will be able to:

  • Explain the meaning of the term “average rate of change.”
  • Estimate or calculate the average rate of change between two points from the graph of a function.

Here are the activities that will help you reach those goals:

  • 4.7.1: Comparing Changes in Output Based on Input
  • 4.7.2: Average Rate of Change and Slope
  • 4.7.2: Self Check
  • 4.7.3: Finding and Interpreting Average Rates of Change
  • 4.7.3: Self Check
  • 4.7.4: Rate of Change of Linear Functions
  • 4.7.4: Self Check
  • 4.7.5: Interpreting Average Rates of Change with Real-World Examples

After that, you’ll practice and review.

  • 4.7.6: Practice
  • 4.7.7: Lesson Summary
